Superman volverá a la televisión en una nueva serie
El hombre de acero regresará a la pantalla chica en un nuevo spin-off del Arrowverso.
04 Nov 2019, 15:57 by Redacción Entretenimiento


Tyler Hoechlin pasará de breves apariciones en Supergirl a tener su propia serie. Foto: Twitter @WarnerChannelLA

Compartir: Facebook Twitter
A pesar de los años, el mercado que se ha creado a partir de los superhéroes sigue vigente y cada día crece más. Tanto Marvel Comics como DC Comics siguen buscando la manera de atraer la atención del público mediante distintas formulas que han resultado èxitosas para cada compañía.
Por su parte, Marvel ha encontrado en el cine y en su  “saga del infinito” la manera de dar a conocer a gran parte de su catalogo de héroes durante los últimos 15 años.



En cambio, para DC Comics la situación no ha sido tan buena en la gran pantalla y se ha refugiado en distintas series de televisión reunidas en lo que se ha denominado como el Arrowverso, es decir, todas las series que han sido creadas tras el estreno de Arrow, el show que enfoca las luces en Flecha Verde y que desde el 2012 ha ido integrando paulatinamente a otros héroes de la casa creativa, tal es el caso de Flash, Supergirl, Batwoman, Atomo, Canario Negro, entro otros.



Pues bien, otro de los héroes que se unirá de lleno a este universo es el siempre bien recibido Superman, quien ya había tenido pequeñas apariciones en algunos crossovers de las series siendo su casa principal la serie de Supergirl.
Hasta donde se sabe, la nueva serie del hombre se acero se titulará “Superman & Lois” y será protagonizada por Tyler Hoechlin y Elizabeth Tulloch respectivamente. Hoechlin ya ha usado la capa roja desde el 2016 en la serie del canal The CW Supergirl, que narra la vida de Kara Zor-El, prima de Superman.
Aunque de la trama aún no se sabe mucho, todo parece indicar que estará centrada en la relación amorosa entre el último hijo de Kriptón y la intrépida periodista del Daily Planet. En la serie se mostrará una poco explorada vida de casados y, aunque de un rumor se trata, además de ver la faceta de esposo de Superman también veríamos su desempeño como padre.
La serie se encuentra en fase de desarrollo y no se tiene una fecha exacta para su lanzamiento. Lo que si se sabe es que estará en manos de Todd Helbing, Greg Berlanti, Sarah Schechter y Geoff Johns, quienes han estado detrás del éxito de todas las series que DC ha lanzado mendiante The CW.



Esta no sería la primera vez que Superman y Lois Lane comparten el nombre de una serie. En 1993 se lanzó un concepto similar titulado 'Lois y Clark: Las nuevas aventuras de Superman', protagonizado por Dean Cain y Teri Hatcher. El programa contó con cuatro temporadas y se emitió desde 1993 hasta 1997.

text:
Superman will return to television in a new series
The man of steel will return to the small screen in a new spin-off of the Arrowverso.
04 Nov 2019, 15:57 by Entertainment Writing


Tyler Hoechlin will go from brief appearances in Supergirl to have his own series. Photo: Twitter @WarnerChannelLA

Share: Facebook Twitter
In spite of the years, the market that has been created from the superheroes is still in force and every day it grows more. Both Marvel Comics and DC Comics are still looking for ways to attract public attention through different formulas that have proved successful for each company.
For its part, Marvel has found in the cinema and in its “saga of the infinite” the way to make known a large part of its catalog of heroes during the last 15 years.



On the other hand, for DC Comics the situation has not been so good on the big screen and has taken refuge in different television series gathered in what has been called the Arrowverse, that is, all the series that have been created after the premiere of Arrow, the show that focuses the lights on Green Arrow and that since 2012 has been gradually integrating other heroes of the creative house, such is the case of Flash, Supergirl, Batwoman, Atomo, Black Canary, among others.



Well, another of the heroes who will fully join this universe is the always well received Superman, who had already had small appearances in some crossovers of the series being his main house the Supergirl series.
As far as is known, the new series of the man is steel will be titled "Superman & Lois" and will star Tyler Hoechlin and Elizabeth Tulloch respectively. Hoechlin has already used the red cape since 2016 in the channel series The CW Supergirl, which chronicles the life of Kara Zor-El, Superman's cousin.
Although not much is known about the plot, everything seems to indicate that it will be centered on the romantic relationship between the last son of Krypton and the intrepid journalist of the Daily Planet. The series will show a little explored married life and, although it is a rumor, in addition to seeing the face of Superman's husband we would also see his performance as a father.
The series is under development and there is no exact date for its launch. What is known is that it will be in the hands of Todd Helbing, Greg Berlanti, Sarah Schechter and Geoff Johns, who have been behind the success of all the series that DC has launched by The CW.



This would not be the first time that Superman and Lois Lane share the name of a series. In 1993 a similar concept was launched entitled 'Lois and Clark: The New Adventures of Superman', starring Dean Cain and Teri Hatcher. The program had four seasons and aired from 1993 to 1997.
